intro: Rhynchospora tepuiana, commonly known as the Tepuian sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Rhynchospora tepuiana plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small vertebrates.
